page.title: 11TETLEY HALL VISIT.
page.content: ONE DAY WE WENT TO TETLEY. THE PRETTY, TREE-LINED AVENUE LED TO THE HALL. IVY COVERED THE FRONT OF THE ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTY YEAR OLD BUILDING. ENTERING THE FRONT HALL WE SAW IT'S WIDE STAIRCASE AND THE BREAKFAST ROOM ON THE MEZZANINE LANDING. THE LARGE DRAWING ROOM HAD A BLAZING LOG FIRE IN A FIREPLACE ON WHEELS. ON COLD DAYS THIS COULD BE MOVED INTO THE{CENTRE}OF THE ROOM. WE ADMIRED THE{STUBBS} PAINTINGS AND CHIPPENDALE FURNITURE. UPSTAIRS, IN THE BEDROOMS WITH DRESSING ROOMS, WE SAW NO SIGN OF THE{ {GHOST.}OUTSIDE, A PARAPET FROM SPROTBOROUGH CASTLE HAD BEEN MADE INTO A BRIDGE AND HAD BEEN MENTIONED IN SIR WALTER SCOTT'S "{IVANHOE}". IN THE CORNER OF THE BEAUTIFULLY LAWNED GARDENS, WE FOUND A PRIVATE {BURIAL {GROUND.}MANY OF THE OWNERS' ANCESTORS HAD BEEN BURIED THERE.
